name: Castor
body:
##  CASTOR
Log-file encryption and authentication utility toying with **Attribute Based Encryption** (_ABE_) and **Identity Based Authentication** (_IBA_), along AES and RSA.

Castor serves as a syslog message processer and is able to handle any message respecting the syslog format, while adaptations to any other format are simple.

***

### Install & Compile
Get the code:

`git clone git://github.com/Shastick/castor.git`

`cd castor`

Initialize and update the submodules (to pull the cpabe library)

`git submodule init`

`git submodule update`

If there is anything else than the two cpabe and bswabe directories in `cpabe/src/main/java/`, move to the specified directory and switch to the stripped branch:

`cd cpabe/src/main/java/`

`git checkout stripped`

You should now be ready to compile:

`sbt compile`

And if you want to run castor from sbt, you'll have to move the `conf` and `
file` directories to the `castor` root.

`mv castor/conf ./`

`mv castor/files ./`

`sbt compile`

`sbt run`

### Configuration
Look at https://github.com/Shastick/castor/blob/master/castor/conf/digester_config.example.scala
and https://github.com/Shastick/castor/blob/master/castor/conf/reader_config.example.scala for configuration examples.

Have fun, and don't hesitate if you have any questions!
J.
